channel.title: Warning: Could not find '/usr/lib/whonixsetup'
channel.description:
Hello. I've just discovered new problem in my Whonix-Workstation. I've got this message in my terminal: [code]Warning: Could not find '/usr/lib/whonixsetup', starting '/bin/bash' instead. Please check your profile settings.[/code]
The day before that I've changed my repository to testers repository, updated and installed apparmor profile for pidgin. After that I've changed it again to stable repository. Today I've got this message.
in my /usr/lib/ directory I've got new files: 1. whonixsetup_cli_start_maybe 2. whonixsetup_x_start_maybe

item.title: Warning: Could not find '/usr/lib/whonixsetup'
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
fix “Warning: Could not find ‘/usr/lib/whonixsetup’, starting ‘/bin/bash’ instead. Please check your profile settings.” by deleting obsolete /etc/xdg/autostart/whonixsetup.desktop:

github.com/Whonix/whonix-legacy

fix "Warning: Could not find '/usr/lib/whonixsetup', starting '/bin/bash' instead. Please check your profile settings." by deleting obsolete /etc/xdg/autostart/whonixsetup.desktop - https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,971.0.html

committed 04:33PM - 16 Apr 15 UTC
adrelanos
+8 -0

Will be fixed in Whonix 10.0.0.5.4 and also with package upgrades soon.

Read full topic

item.title: Warning: Could not find '/usr/lib/whonixsetup'
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
What Whonix version are you using? Using Whonix testers apt repository by chance?

It’s not a big deal. Will likely be fixed in Whonix 10.

Read full topic
